p: The above discussion on various approaches to resilience serves as the theoretical base of this study. Since we focus on community resilience, it is now clear that community resilience is soft, social, and one of the most adopted approaches in addressing disasters in societies in recent time. The central strength of a community resilience approach, as a type of social resilience, is its characteristic both as an ‘outcome’ and a ‘process’. Since identifying community resilience is the key purpose of this paper, the following section briefly outlines the major relevant issues.
